name: SYN Flood Attack
description: High rate of SYN packets from a single source to a single destination, indicating a SYN flood.

name: TCP Port Scan (Low Ports)
description: Multiple connection attempts to various low-numbered TCP ports (0-1023) on a single host.

name: TCP Port Scan (High Ports)
description: Multiple connection attempts to various high-numbered TCP ports (1024-65535) on a single host.

name: UDP Flood Attack
description: High rate of UDP packets from a single source to a single destination, indicating a UDP flood.

name: ICMP Flood Attack
description: High rate of ICMP packets from a single source to a single destination, indicating an ICMP flood.

name: XMAS Scan Detected
description: TCP packet with FIN, URG, and PUSH flags set, typically used for stealth scanning.

name: FIN Scan Detected
description: TCP packet with only the FIN flag set, often used to bypass firewalls.

name: NULL Scan Detected
description: TCP packet with no flags set, often used for stealth scanning.

name: SYN-ACK without SYN
description: Received a SYN-ACK packet without a prior SYN from the same source, potentially indicating a spoofed connection or odd network behavior.

name: RST Flood Attack
description: High volume of TCP RST packets, possibly indicating an attempt to tear down connections.
